intro: Lithospermum corymbosum, commonly known as red sandalwood, is a herbaceous perennial native to the eastern United States. It is characterized by its upright, branching stems and opposite, lance-shaped leaves that are typically covered in fine hairs. The plant produces showy, clustered flowers that range in color from white to pink, which bloom in late summer. Its roots contain compounds that have been historically used in traditional medicine. Lithospermum corymbosum is often found in moist, open woods and thrives in partial shade to full sun.
